inclusion.criterion: Patients must have a recurrent supratentorial WHO Grade III malignant glioma or WHO Grade IV malignant glioma, medulloblastoma, or atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor (ATRT) based on imaging studies with measurable disease
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine, but it's not specified as supratentorial. Also, there is no mention of measurable disease.

inclusion.criterion: Prior histopathology must be consistent with a World Health Organization (WHO) Grade III or IV malignant tumor confirmed by the study pathologist
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma, but it's not clear if it's WHO Grade III or IV.

inclusion.criterion: There is no standard of care treatment for children with Grade III/IV gliomas; however, patients must have received some form of definitive treatment prior to their recurrence/progression
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has received radiation therapy and chemotherapy.

inclusion.criterion: The patient must be ≥ 12 years of age and ≤ 21 years of age at the time of entry into the study
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient is a 45-year-old man, so he's outside the age range.

inclusion.criterion: The patient must have a Lansky or Karnofsky Performance Score (KPS) of ≥ 70% at the time of entry
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention, so it's unclear if his KPS is ≥ 70%

inclusion.criterion: Laboratory Studies: Platelet count ≥ 125,000 per microliter prior to biopsy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The patient must have received a boost immunization with trivalent inactivated IPOL™ ≥ 1 week prior to administration of the study agent
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has received radiation therapy and chemotherapy, which likely includes a boost immunization.

inclusion.criterion: Able to undergo brain MRI with and without contrast without requiring general anesthesia
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's ability to undergo MRI.

exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: Patient is a man, so this criterion does not apply.

exclusion.criterion: Patients with an impending, life-threatening cerebral herniation syndrome
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's condition being life-threatening.

exclusion.criterion: Patients with known immunosuppressive disease or known human immunodeficiency virus infection
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient having immunosuppressive disease or HIV infection.

exclusion.criterion: Current or history of anaphylactic reaction to gadolinium
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's allergy to gadolinium.

notes: Patient is outside the age range and has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention, which may affect his KPS. Also, it's unclear if he meets the laboratory studies criteria.
